column4: I just updated to edgy, but I'm still having problems viewing websites with flash
can anyone help me?
I tried downloading it through links on firefox, but the installer is not coming up right, either
have you installed flashplugin-nonfree from multiverse?
k, if you want to get my attention, prefix what you say with my name
ok, open up a terminal, type this command and tell me the output:  apt-cache policy flashplugin-nonfree | grep -i Installed
ok good.  Now restart your browser and visit http://www.macromedia.com/software/flash/about/ .  Is the flash working there?
ok, what isn't working?
is it a public website?  If so, what is the url?
it works here, maybe you can try using flash9beta
you'll need to enable -backports to upgrade flashplugin-nonfree
apt-cache policy flashplugin-nonfree   now says you have version 9?
ok, open up a terminal, type this command and tell me the output:  apt-cache policy flashplugin-nonfree | grep -i Installed
ok do this:  sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree
then you have not added -backports
pastebin your /etc/apt/sources.list file please
type 'gedit /etc/apt/sources.list' then copy and paste the results to pastebin
not here.  Are you using http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/ ?
well that's strange.  Try pastebin.ca
url?
ah, breezy does not have flash9 in the repositories.  You'll need to install it manually.  Grab it here http://labs.adobe.com/downloads/flashplayer9.html and uninstall flashplugin-nonfree
